body:
### Problem

Occasionally, when I am using `nvim-treesitter`'s incremental selection, neovim crashes. I see it occurring while editing Rust and Python files.

At first I was pretty sure it was https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24783 and https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/23613, which was finally fixed by https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/24796 and back ported to nvim v0.9.2. But even after updating I am still seeing similar crashes.

In the archive below are two coredumps of the crash, and following it the output of `bt` in gdb for the last coredump.

[coredumps.tar.gz](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/12667664/coredumps.tar.gz)

<details>
  <summary>Backtrace</summary>

```gdb
           PID: 4597 (nvim)
           UID: 1000 (rodrigodd)
           GID: 1000 (rodrigodd)
        Signal: 11 (SEGV)
     Timestamp: Tue 2023-09-19 21:39:53 -03 (39min ago)

```

</details>

### Steps to reproduce

I tried both reproduction steps in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24783 and https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/23613, but they either did not triggered the crash or didn't work in v0.9.2 (missing treesitter parser, even though `:help treesitter-parsers` says neovim bundles them by default?).

I could not create a reproduction, at least not yet.

### Expected behavior

not crash

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.2 Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.1694285958     system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"   fall-back for $VIM: "/usr/share/nvim"  Run :checkhealth for more info

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux, kernel 6.5.3-zen1-1-zen

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.12.2 (9d9982df)

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

pacman -S neovim

comment_data.body:
I was able to capture two coredump of the crash with a debug build of neovim, with UBSAN enabled (which is constantly reporting leaked lua objects on exit, is it normal?).

Below is the backtrace and coredump of the last crash that I capture (the other one was too big to attach here).

<details>
<summary>Backtrace</summary>

```gdb
           PID: 20731 (nvim)
           UID: 1000 (rodrigodd)
           GID: 1000 (rodrigodd)
        Signal: 6 (ABRT)
     Timestamp: Sat 2023-09-30 21:14:46 -03 (16min ago)
  Command Line: nvim --embed render/src/lib.rs
    Executable: /usr/local/bin/nvim
 Control Group: /user.slice/user-1000.slice/session-3.scope
          Unit: session-3.scope
         Slice: user-1000.slice
       Session: 3
     Owner UID: 1000 (rodrigodd)
       Boot ID: 3cf08da0240a46dca9e4e750392aa9b9
    Machine ID: e031b41f9df244e2b74641456973fcab
      Hostname: nb-rodrigo
       Storage: /var/lib/systemd/coredump/core.nvim.1000.3cf08da0240a46dca9e4e750392aa9b9.20731.1696119286000000.zst (present)
  Size on Disk: 12.5M
       Message: Process 20731 (nvim) of user 1000 dumped core.
                
                Stack trace of thread 20731:
                #0  0x00007f7efde8e83c n/a (libc.so.6 + 0x8e83c)
                #1  0x00007f7efde3e668 raise (libc.so.6 + 0x3e668)
                #2  0x00007f7efde264b8 abort (libc.so.6 + 0x264b8)
                #3  0x000055b338f000b1 _ZN11__sanitizer5AbortEv (nvim + 0xcd10b1)
                #4  0x000055b338efd852 _ZN11__sanitizer3DieEv (nvim + 0xcce852)
                #5  0x000055b338edefe0 _ZN6__asan19ScopedInErrorReportD1Ev (nvim + 0xcaffe0)
                #6  0x000055b338edb5c1 _ZN6__asan18ReportDeadlySignalERKN11__sanitizer13SignalContextE (nvim + 0xcac5c1)
                #7  0x000055b338eda379 _ZN6__asan18AsanOnDeadlySignalEiPvS0_ (nvim + 0xcab379)
                #8  0x00007f7efde3e710 n/a (libc.so.6 + 0x3e710)
                #9  0x000055b33a8e94cc ts_subtree_size (nvim + 0x26ba4cc)
                #10 0x000055b33a8eea18 ts_node_end_point (nvim + 0x26bfa18)
                #11 0x000055b339aeae2a node_range (nvim + 0x18bbe2a)
                #12 0x000055b33a9337d6 lj_BC_FUNCC (nvim + 0x27047d6)
                #13 0x000055b33a91fc35 lua_pcall (nvim + 0x26f0c35)
                #14 0x000055b339acdcbe nlua_pcall (nvim + 0x189ecbe)
                #15 0x000055b339acd428 nlua_typval_exec (nvim + 0x189e428)
                #16 0x000055b339ad02ec ex_lua (nvim + 0x18a12ec)
                #17 0x000055b3397be9ff execute_cmd0 (nvim + 0x158f9ff)
                #18 0x000055b33979bd6d do_one_cmd (nvim + 0x156cd6d)
                #19 0x000055b33978c5b5 do_cmdline (nvim + 0x155d5b5)
                #20 0x000055b339e0a328 nv_colon (nvim + 0x1bdb328)
                #21 0x000055b339df5dd6 normal_execute (nvim + 0x1bc6dd6)
                #22 0x000055b33a40427d state_enter (nvim + 0x21d527d)
                #23 0x000055b339dd9191 normal_enter (nvim + 0x1baa191)
                #24 0x000055b338f212b1 main (nvim + 0xcf22b1)
                #25 0x00007f7efde27cd0 n/a (libc.so.6 + 0x27cd0)
                #26 0x00007f7efde27d8a __libc_start_main (libc.so.6 + 0x27d8a)
                #27 0x000055b338de6db5 _start (nvim + 0xbb7db5)
                
                Stack trace of thread 20733:
                #0  0x0000000000000000 n/a (n/a + 0x0)
                #1  0x000055b33bd3f940 ins_compl_show_statusmsg.match_ref (nvim + 0x3b10940)
                ELF object binary architecture: AMD x86-64
```

</details>

[dumps.tar.gz](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/12775791/dumps.tar.gz)

I was hoping that the UBSAN would catch the bug earlier, but it is still happening in the same place. But now it is possible to see that the crash actually happens in `ts_subtree_size`, while dereferencing `self.ptr`.

I am not familiar with neither `treesitter` nor `neovim` code base, but `self` is a `Subtree`, which is a union between a `SubtreeInlineData` and a pointer to `SubtreeHeapData`. It check which variant it is by checking the bitfield `is_inline`, which appears to be one of the 8 first bits of the union.

The problem is that `is_inline` is false, but the `ptr` is a too small value (`0x2034`) to be pointing to a value memory. The other crash have a similar small value (`0x2B72`).

Below is the value of `TSNode`, which contains the `id` field, which is casted to `Subtree` immediately before passing to `ts_subtree_size`.

```gdb
(gdb) print (TSNode)self
$15 = {context = {18686, 558, 12, 0}, id = 0x6080002e9aa0, tree = 0x6030002fb0c0}
(gdb) print *(Subtree *)self.id
$16 = {data = {is_inline = false, visible = false, named = true, extra = false, has_changes = true, is_missing = true, is_keyword = false, symbol = 32 ' ',
    parse_state = 0, padding_columns = 0 '\000', padding_rows = 0 '\000', lookahead_bytes = 0 '\000', padding_bytes = 0 '\000', size_bytes = 0 '\000'}, ptr = 0x2034}
(gdb) print *(TSTree *)self.tree
$17 = {root = {data = {is_inline = false, visible = false, named = false, extra = false, has_changes = true, is_missing = true, is_keyword = false, symbol = 1 '\001',
      parse_state = 48, padding_columns = 128 '\200', padding_rows = 0 '\000', lookahead_bytes = 6 '\006', padding_bytes = 0 '\000', size_bytes = 0 '\000'},
    ptr = 0x6080003001b0}, language = 0x7f7ef9f02d20 <language>, included_ranges = 0x6030002fb0f0, included_range_count = 1}
```

Does anyone has any idea what could cause this problem? I could not even find where `id` is assigned.

I would also appreciate if anyone could give me any tips on how could I debug this.

## nvim -v

```
NVIM v0.9.2
Build type: Debug
LuaJIT 2.1.1692716794
Compilation: /usr/bin/clang -g -fno-sanitize-recover=all -fno-omit-frame-pointer -fno-optimize-sibling-calls -fsanitize=address -fsanitize=undefined -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wvla -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -Wimplicit-fallthrough -fdiagnostics-color=always -fstack-protector-strong -DNVIM_LOG_DEBUG -DUNIT_TESTING -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -D_GNU_SOURCE -DEXITFREE -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1 -I/usr/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/build/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/build/cmake.config -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src -I/usr/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/usr/include

   system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "/usr/local/share/nvim"

Run :checkhealth for more info
```

I made a patch to neovim to see if I could trigger the issue early (I though that maybe a invalid node tree was being pushed to the Lua stack).

<details>

 <summary>patch</summary>

```diff
diff --git a/src/nvim/lua/treesitter.c b/src/nvim/lua/treesitter.c
index 988126a4e..5aa7cfa63 100644
--- a/src/nvim/lua/treesitter.c
+++ b/src/nvim/lua/treesitter.c
@@ -47,6 +47,23 @@ typedef struct {
   TSTree *tree;
 } TSLuaTree;
 
+struct SubtreeInlineData {
+  bool is_inline : 1;
+  bool visible : 1;
+  bool named : 1;
+  bool extra : 1;
+  bool has_changes : 1;
+  bool is_missing : 1;
+  bool is_keyword : 1;
+  uint8_t symbol;
+  uint16_t parse_state;
+  uint8_t padding_columns;
+  uint8_t padding_rows : 4;
+  uint8_t lookahead_bytes : 4;
+  uint8_t padding_bytes;
+  uint8_t size_bytes;
+};
+
 #ifdef INCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS
 # include "lua/treesitter.c.generated.h"
 #endif
@@ -750,6 +767,14 @@ static void push_node(lua_State *L, TSNode node, int uindex)
     lua_pushnil(L);  // [nil]
     return;
   }
+
+  if (node.id != NULL) {
+    struct SubtreeInlineData *subtree = (struct SubtreeInlineData *)node.id;
+    if (!subtree->is_inline) {
+      assert((intptr_t)subtree > 0xffff);
+    }
+  }
+
   TSNode *ud = lua_newuserdata(L, sizeof(TSNode));  // [udata]
   *ud = node;
   lua_getfield(L, LUA_REGISTRYINDEX, TS_META_NODE);  // [udata, meta]
@@ -763,6 +788,14 @@ static bool node_check(lua_State *L, int index, TSNode *res)
   TSNode *ud = luaL_checkudata(L, index, TS_META_NODE);
   if (ud) {
     *res = *ud;
+
+    if (res->id != NULL) {
+      struct SubtreeInlineData *subtree = (struct SubtreeInlineData *)res->id;
+      if (!subtree->is_inline) {
+        assert((intptr_t)subtree > 0xffff);
+      }
+    }
+
     return true;
   }
   return false;
```

</details>

This change didn't make the crash happen as early as I was intended, but it made ASAN able detect a heap-user-after-free:

<details>

 <summary>ASAN heap-use-after-free</summary>

```gdb
=================================================================

READ of size 1 at 0x608000095fa0 thread T0
    #0 0x557a487deddc in node_check /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/lua/treesitter.c:775:21
    #1 0x557a487e0f04 in node_range /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/lua/treesitter.c:828:8
    #2 0x557a49629b95 in lj_BC_FUNCC (/usr/local/bin/nvim+0x2704b95) (BuildId: 64279e2d8963ae255769c01ee3cd6047ed18920b)
    #3 0x557a49615ff4 in lua_pcall /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/.deps/build/src/luajit/src/lj_api.c:1145:12
    #4 0x557a487c3cbd in nlua_pcall /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/lua/executor.c:159:16
    #5 0x557a487c3427 in nlua_typval_exec /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/lua/executor.c:1443:7
    #6 0x557a487c62eb in ex_lua /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/lua/executor.c:1639:3
    #7 0x557a484b49fe in execute_cmd0 /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:1620:7
    #8 0x557a48491d6c in do_one_cmd /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:2279:7
    #9 0x557a484825b4 in do_cmdline /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:578:20
    #10 0x557a48b006e7 in nv_colon /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:3247:18
    #11 0x557a48aec195 in normal_execute /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:1207:3
    #12 0x557a490fa63c in state_enter /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/state.c:99:26
    #13 0x557a48acf550 in normal_enter /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:497:3
    #14 0x557a47c172b0 in main /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/main.c:642:3
    #15 0x7f7c31c3eccf  (/usr/lib/libc.so.6+0x27ccf) (BuildId: 8bfe03f6bf9b6a6e2591babd0bbc266837d8f658)
    #16 0x7f7c31c3ed89 in __libc_start_main (/usr/lib/libc.so.6+0x27d89) (BuildId: 8bfe03f6bf9b6a6e2591babd0bbc266837d8f658)
    #17 0x557a47adcdb4 in _start (/usr/local/bin/nvim+0xbb7db4) (BuildId: 64279e2d8963ae255769c01ee3cd6047ed18920b)

0x608000095fa0 is located 0 bytes inside of 86-byte region [0x608000095fa0,0x608000095ff6)
freed by thread T0 here:
    #0 0x557a47bca5a2 in __interceptor_free.part.0 asan_malloc_linux.cpp.o
    #1 0x557a489c1948 in xfree /home/rodrigodd/repos/neovim/src/nvim/memory.c:134:3
```

The coredump was too big to attach here, but the same observed problem as before happened, the value `(TSNode *)->id.ptr` is too small (`0x1470`).

@nwounkn, @bfredl both of you work on fixing the double free in #24783. Do any of you have any idea on how can I debug this further? Or I will need a reproducible program first?
